Reason: The configuration option 'internode_tcp_user_timeout_in_ms' in the 'cassandra' software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the timeout for TCP connections between nodes in a distributed system. A lower timeout value can lead to quicker detection of failed nodes but may also result in increased reconnection attempts and potential performance degradation. Conversely, a higher timeout value may reduce unnecessary reconnection attempts but could also prolong the detection of failed nodes, impacting system responsiveness and overall performance.
